intro: Trichocentrum leeanum, commonly known as the Lianan orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It features pendulous, showy inflorescences with fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has long, slender stems that can grow up to several meters in length, often climbing trees or other structures. Its leaves are narrow,革质 (leathery), and arranged alternately along the stem. Trichocentrum leeanum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
